stanza.line: Thine eyes I love and they as pitying (a)me(/a)
Knowing thy heart torment me with (b)disdain(/b)
Have put on black and loving mourners (a)be(/a)
Looking with pretty ruth upon my (b)pain(/b)
And truly not the morning sun of (c)heaven(/c)
Better becomes the grey cheeks of the (d)east(/d)
Nor that full star that ushers in the (c)even(/c)
Doth half that glory to the sober (d)west(/d)
As those two mourning eyes become thy (e)face(/e)
O let it then as well beseem thy (f)heart(/f)
To mourn for me since mourning doth thee (e)grace(/e)
And suit thy pity like in every (f)part(/f)
Then will I swear beauty herself is (g)black(/g)
And all they foul that thy complexion (g)lack(/g)
